poem:
### Asparagus Record

Amid Rome's kitchen warmth,  
a tale from Ontario sprouts.  
Green spears, long as dreams—  
351.7 centimeters  
harvested in history's clasp.  
Pumpkinfest legends lean,  
unaware of asparagus' reach.  
Gardens whisper,  
asking, between space and sun,  
what breaks record,  
what feeds soul,  
and where long green shoots rest  
in weighty silence.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rachel Roddy’s recipe for asparagus, pea and rice soup-stew | A kitchen in Rome According to the Guinness World Record’s official website, 351.7cm was the length of the asparagus presented by Harry and Carson Willemse at the Port Elgin Pumpkinfest in Ontario, Canada, on 2 October 2004. Sadly, however, the Pumpkinfest’s own archives hold only the records of master growers and weigh-offs dating back to 2017, and are almost entirely pumpkin-related. Gardening websites and Pinterest,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Rachel Roddy’s recipe for asparagus, pea and rice soup-stew | A kitchen in Rome According to the Guinness World Record’s official website, 351.7cm was the length of the asparagus presented by Harry and Carson Willemse at the Port Elgin Pumpkinfest in Ontario, Canada, on 2 October 2004. Sadly, however, the Pumpkinfest’s own archives hold only the records of master growers and weigh-offs dating back to 2017, and are almost entirely pumpkin-related. Gardening websites and Pinterest,
